name: Aircraft Jack
description: Hydraulic jack for lifting aircraft during maintenance
operation_instructions: Position jack at approved jacking point. Ensure aircraft is properly balanced with other jacks. Raise slowly and install safety pins.
safety_precautions: Never exceed rated capacity
Always use on level, solid surface
Always use safety pins when aircraft is raised
Never work under aircraft supported only by jacks
maintenance_requirements: Inspect hydraulic fluid level monthly. Test operation quarterly. Full inspection and certification annually.

name: Nitrogen Service Cart
description: Mobile cart for servicing aircraft nitrogen systems
operation_instructions: Connect to aircraft service port using appropriate adapter. Set regulator to specified pressure. Open valve slowly to charge system.
safety_precautions: Wear eye protection
Secure cylinders properly
Never exceed maximum rated pressure
Keep away from heat sources and open flames
maintenance_requirements: Inspect hoses and connections monthly. Test regulators and gauges quarterly. Hydrostatic test of cylinders every 5 years.

name: Aircraft Tug
description: Powered tug for moving aircraft on the ground
operation_instructions: Attach tow bar to aircraft and tug. Ensure aircraft brakes are released. Operate at slow speed. Follow proper turning radius limitations.
safety_precautions: Ensure proper training before operation
Use wing walkers when in confined spaces
Never exceed aircraft towing speed limits
Never turn beyond aircraft turning radius limits
maintenance_requirements: Daily fluid level checks. Weekly lubrication. 250-hour service intervals.

name: Hydraulic Mule
description: Mobile hydraulic power unit for aircraft system testing
operation_instructions: Connect to aircraft hydraulic service port using appropriate adapter. Set pressure to specified value. Monitor temperature and pressure during operation.
safety_precautions: Wear eye protection and gloves
Ensure all connections are secure before pressurizing
Never exceed aircraft system pressure limits
Keep clear of moving surfaces powered by hydraulic system
maintenance_requirements: Check fluid level and condition before each use. Change filters every 500 hours. Full service every 1000 hours.

name: Aircraft Battery Charger
operation_instructions: Connect to battery observing polarity. Select appropriate voltage and charging mode. Monitor charging progress.
safety_precautions: Ensure proper ventilation
Verify correct voltage selection before connecting
Disconnect aircraft electrical system before charging
Keep away from flammable materials
maintenance_requirements: Inspect cables and connections monthly. Calibrate meters annually.

name: Oxygen Service Cart
description: Mobile cart for servicing aircraft oxygen systems
operation_instructions: Connect to aircraft service port using appropriate adapter. Set regulator to specified pressure. Open valve slowly to charge system.
safety_precautions: Keep free of oil and grease
Wear oxygen-clean gloves when handling connections
No smoking or open flames within 50 feet
Use only oxygen-approved components and lubricants
maintenance_requirements: Inspect hoses and connections monthly. Test regulators and gauges quarterly. Hydrostatic test of cylinders every 5 years.

name: Engine Hoist
description: Specialized hoist for aircraft engine removal and installation
operation_instructions: Position hoist under engine. Attach to engine mounting points using appropriate hardware. Balance load before lifting. Raise/lower slowly.
safety_precautions: Verify weight of engine before lifting
Never exceed rated capacity
Ensure all attachment points are secure
Keep personnel clear of suspended load
Use tag lines to control movement
maintenance_requirements: Inspect cables, hooks, and hydraulic system before each use. Annual certification required.

name: Pitot-Static Test Set
description: Equipment for testing aircraft pitot-static systems
operation_instructions: Connect to aircraft pitot and static ports using appropriate adapters. Seal all other ports. Perform tests according to aircraft maintenance manual.
safety_precautions: Never exceed aircraft limits for rate of climb/descent
Monitor aircraft instruments during testing
Ensure all connections are secure before applying pressure/vacuum
Release pressure/vacuum slowly after testing
maintenance_requirements: Verify calibration before use. Annual calibration required.

name: Fuel Quantity Test Set
description: Equipment for testing aircraft fuel quantity indicating systems
operation_instructions: Connect to aircraft fuel quantity system access points. Simulate various fuel levels by adjusting capacitance values. Compare with aircraft indicators.
safety_precautions: Ensure aircraft power is at correct level
Follow aircraft maintenance manual procedures
Verify all connections before applying power
maintenance_requirements: Verify calibration before use. Annual calibration required.

name: Aircraft Scales
operation_instructions: Position scales under aircraft wheels. Level aircraft according to manufacturer's specifications. Record individual wheel weights and calculate center of gravity.
safety_precautions: Ensure aircraft is properly secured
Perform weighing in enclosed hangar with no wind
Verify scales are on level surface
Follow aircraft maintenance manual procedures
maintenance_requirements: Verify calibration before use. Annual calibration required.
